verses.kjv: And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.
verses.web: He entered into a boat, and crossed over, and came into his own city.
verses.ct: Jesus got into a boat, crossed the lake, and arrived in his own city.

verses.kjv: And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy; Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.
verses.web: Behold, they brought to him a man who was paralyzed, lying on a bed. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.ct: Some people brought him a paralyzed man lying on a mat. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, "Take heart, son! Your sins are forgiven."

verses.kjv: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.
verses.web: Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man blasphemes.”
verses.ct: Some of the scribes thought to themselves, "This man is blaspheming!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?
verses.web: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?
verses.ct: Jesus knew exactly what they were thinking and said, "Why are you harboring such evil thoughts?

verses.kjv: For whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?
verses.web: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Get up, and walk?’
verses.ct: Which is easier to say — 'Your sins are forgiven,' or 'Get up and walk'?

verses.kjv: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (then saith he to the sick of the palsy,) Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.
verses.web: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins-” (then he said to the paralytic), “Get up, and take up your mat, and go to your house.”
verses.ct: But so you'll know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins —" he turned to the paralyzed man and said, "Get up, pick up your mat, and go home."

verses.kjv: And he arose, and departed to his house.
verses.web: He arose and departed to his house.
verses.ct: The man stood up and went home.

verses.kjv: But when the multitudes saw it, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.
verses.web: But when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such authority to men.
verses.ct: When the crowds saw this, they were amazed and praised God for giving such authority to a human being.

verses.kjv: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose, and followed him.
verses.web: As Jesus passed by from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax collection office. He said to him, “Follow me.” He got up and followed him.
verses.ct: As Jesus moved on from there, he noticed a man named Matthew sitting at his tax collection booth. Jesus said to him, "Follow me." Matthew got up and followed him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.
verses.web: As he sat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.
verses.ct: Later, while Jesus was eating at Matthew's house, a large number of tax collectors and sinners came and joined him and his disciples at the table.

verses.kjv: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?
verses.web: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.ct: When the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, "Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?"

verses.kjv: But when Jesus heard that, he said unto them, They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.
verses.web: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.
verses.ct: Jesus overheard them and replied, "Healthy people don't need a doctor — sick people do.

verses.kjv: But go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
verses.web: But you go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ for I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.ct: Go and figure out what this means: 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice.' I didn't come to call the righteous. I came to call sinners to repentance."

verses.kjv: Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?
verses.web: Then John’s disciples came to him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don’t fast?”
verses.ct: Then John's disciples came to Jesus and asked, "We fast often, and so do the Pharisees. Why don't your disciples fast?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “Can the friends of the bridegroom mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "Do wedding guests mourn while the groom is still with them? Of course not. But the time will come when the groom is taken away from them, and then they'll fast.

verses.kjv: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.
verses.web: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch would tear away from the garment, and a worse hole is made.
verses.ct: Nobody patches an old garment with unshrunk cloth. The new patch would pull away from the old fabric and make the tear even worse.

verses.kjv: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles: else the bottles break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottles perish: but they put new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.
verses.web: Neither do people put new wine into old wine skins, or else the skins would burst, and the wine be spilled, and the skins ruined. No, they put new wine into fresh wine skins, and both are preserved.”
verses.ct: And nobody pours new wine into old wineskins. If they did, the skins would burst, the wine would spill out, and the skins would be ruined. Instead, new wine goes into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved."

verses.kjv: While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.
verses.web: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”
verses.ct: While Jesus was saying these things, a synagogue leader came and knelt before him. "My daughter has just died," he said. "But if you come and place your hand on her, she will live."

verses.kjv: And Jesus arose, and followed him, and so did his disciples.
verses.web: Jesus got up and followed him, as did his disciples.
verses.ct: Jesus got up and went with him, and so did his disciples.

verses.kjv: And, behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind him, and touched the hem of his garment:
verses.web: Behold, a woman who had a discharge of blood for twelve years came behind him, and touched the fringe of his garment;
verses.ct: Just then, a woman who had been suffering from bleeding for 12 years came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his garment.

verses.kjv: For she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.
verses.web: for she said within herself, “If I just touch his garment, I will be made well.”
verses.ct: She had told herself, "If I can just touch his clothes, I'll be healed."

verses.kjv: But Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said, Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole. And the woman was made whole from that hour.
verses.web: But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said, “Daughter, cheer up! Your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that hour.
verses.ct: Jesus turned around, and when he saw her, he said, "Take heart, daughter! Your faith has made you well." From that moment on, the woman was healed.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,
verses.web: When Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the flute players, and the crowd in noisy disorder,
verses.ct: When Jesus arrived at the ruler's house, he saw flute players and a crowd of people wailing loudly.

verses.kjv: He said unto them, Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth. And they laughed him to scorn.
verses.web: he said to them, “Make room, because the girl isn’t dead, but sleeping.” They were ridiculing him.
verses.ct: He told them, "Everyone out. The girl isn't dead — she's sleeping." They laughed at him.

verses.kjv: But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.
verses.web: But when the crowd was put out, he entered in, took her by the hand, and the girl arose.
verses.ct: After the crowd had been sent outside, Jesus went in, took the girl by the hand, and she got up.

verses.kjv: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.
verses.web: The report of this went out into all that land.
verses.ct: News of this spread throughout the entire region.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, Thou son of David, have mercy on us.
verses.web: As Jesus passed by from there, two blind men followed him, calling out and saying, “Have mercy on us, son of David!”
verses.ct: As Jesus left that place, 2 blind men followed him, shouting, "Son of David, have mercy on us!"

verses.kjv: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They said unto him, Yea, Lord.
verses.web: When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They told him, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.ct: When he went inside a house, the blind men came to him. Jesus asked them, "Do you believe I can do this?" They answered, "Yes, Lord."

verses.kjv: Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.
verses.web: Then he touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith be it done to you.”
verses.ct: Then he touched their eyes and said, "Let it happen for you according to your faith."

verses.kjv: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See that no man know it.
verses.web: Their eyes were opened. Jesus strictly commanded them, saying, “See that no one knows about this.”
verses.ct: Their eyes were opened, and they could see. Jesus gave them a stern warning: "Make sure no one finds out about this."

verses.kjv: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.
verses.web: But they went out and spread abroad his fame in all that land.
verses.ct: But as soon as they left, they spread the news about him all over that region.

verses.kjv: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.
verses.web: As they went out, behold, a mute man who was demon possessed was brought to him.
verses.ct: As those 2 men were leaving, some people brought Jesus a man who couldn't speak because he was possessed by a demon.

verses.kjv: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.
verses.web: When the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. The multitudes marveled, saying, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!”
verses.ct: Once Jesus drove the demon out, the man spoke. The crowds were astonished and said, "Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!"

verses.kjv: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.
verses.web: But the Pharisees said, “By the prince of the demons, he casts out demons.”
verses.ct: But the Pharisees claimed, "He drives out demons by the power of the prince of demons."

verses.kjv: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
verses.web: Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
verses.ct: Jesus traveled through all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, proclaiming the good news of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and sickness among the people.

verses.kjv: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
verses.web: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them, because they were harassed and scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.
verses.ct: When he looked out at the crowds, his heart broke for them. They were worn out and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.

verses.kjv: Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few;
verses.web: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest indeed is plentiful, but the laborers are few.
verses.ct: He told his disciples, "The harvest is enormous, but the workers are few.

verses.kjv: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.
verses.web: Pray therefore that the Lord of the harvest will send out laborers into his harvest.”
verses.ct: So pray and ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest."
